ttEEzq1HEPbHodUwj3dWuQ.text: I love the custom rolls that they have. Last time I did hazelnut cream with Pecans on top. It was so good I finished the whole thing.

oYXSDK7vP6IWBsFs1xCwaQ.text: I am OBSESSED with this place! As a vegan, it is difficult to find quality desserts and Cinnaholic has exceeded all expectations! If you haven't tried it, you are missing out. Absolutely delicious!

ylbUym2pzZQB8gbByHDcaA.text: They have the best vegan desserts. Everything I have tried has been amazing. My husband who isn't vegan even loves them!

EooZqQH7tLia1OhfWiWirQ.text: Stood in line for over an hour today and was so disappointed. My cinnamon roll didn't look anything like the pictures. I ordered a cinnamon roll with chocolate icing and almonds, and the cinnamon in the roll overpowered the toppings and the roll itself was underbaked. Pillsbury Grands are a better option and a much better price. Cinnaholic is way overpriced for what you get.

_3Ax7xWDpPaspX-RQKX1DA.text: The concept of the idea is great, but it's pretty pricy. One cinnamon roll is close to $5 without any toppings, and when you start to build your own then it gets pricy. Service wasn't the best, seemed like the cashier who was there didn't want to be there. Also it's really sweet, so if you have a big sweet tooth, then I recommend this place for you. If not, then definitely avoid this place and get some ice cream instead.

4dUZGGv_YSScbu_Pdqcr6Q.text: The cinnamon roll treats here are sooooo good.  Plus there is egg free cookie dough that is delicious.  To top it off there is great friendly staff working.  Loved it!!

kEhru2dM7GRW3R-z9bQzsQ.text: Arrived at7:45 (updated time)they were out of cinnamon buns, not a good!!! Very unhappy customer!!! And they didn't apologize!'n

-YMls46Dwzr_QAR8mpav5g.text: Definitely above average. We love having this little quaint store in our local shopping area. We visit at least once a week. Who doesn't love customizing their deserts.

GZv4uvQI1Ss6QqKVv9iApA.text: Gotta have one!! Best place to satisfy your sweet tooth(teeth).. friendly staff with minimal waiting. Good location! Need more around the area..

SKpuj9CHgvq-yeASxA8ZFg.text: Great customer service! We went late at night and got the $1 cinnamon rolls and they were amazing!! Will definitely make a visit back.

eip3cyGA3G1yVAyAgdCaiQ.text: While you have to wait a good bit to order, the cinnamon buns are delicious. We ordered the peanut butter syrup with cookie dough topping and it came out to be about $6. Considering it's such a new take on desserts, I thought the price was fair.

qRxHG0167Quo5W-oM3tJSQ.text: Uhhhhhhhmazing. I was in Atlanta during NYE weekend looking for a good dessert place and this came up. A few months later one was opening 10 minutes away from me?? Heck yeah! I went tonight, super busy but it ended up being worth the wait.

cPbNfIuQWPfWvuK13Znwzg.text: The location is clean and the staff is nice and fast. Most everything tastes great! The hours are a bit odd and the caramel sauce was not good, but those are minor because everything else I've tried is excellent. Specifically the cookie dough and cream cheese buns. Glad this place exists. It is a bit pricy, but I do feel it's worth it for a treat.

WkUHUsLNQeYeoOI_Li1fcw.text: Just had the basic cinnamon roll- which was okay for being vegan, however, totally not worth $5. So over priced for what it is. Definitely won't be coming back but at least we tried it.

Wokzz6cbNnPbGlIz3LYVbQ.text: As a local resident, I was pretty excited to try Cinnaholic. I stopped by on a Saturday night and no surprise the line was to the door. I thought that the checkout process was very nice. One of the workers walked through the line and took orders. I felt that this shortened the wait time. It was my first time, so it was a little hectic trying to decide on what to order. I decided to top my cinnamon roll with raspberry sauce and sprinkles. Payments are taken at one window on an IPad and then there's another window for order pickup. I thought that my order was pretty good. I plan on coming back to try other combinations. I didn't have a chance to fully check out the ambiance of the store but it seems pretty simple. The only downside was the bottled lemonade. I thought that the price was a little much. It was $2 for 10.5 Fl Oz. The taste was not appealing to me either. I had an overall great experience and would recommend others to try Cinnaholic!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

664LrV4p1hbZ4EjbSEIQIA.text: The cinnamon rolls were amazing! Did not taste vegan at all. I got cookie dough served on top and it was really good. The cookie dough did not taste vegan at all.

YpWb9jd5Hl6fxvLlRcg3Vg.text: This place was a pleasant surprise! Everything was hot and had a great flavor! I wasn't wild about the peanut butter icing. Everything else really good. I'd definitely go back.

ICgV4kyo0tMG7A05URskjA.text: Amazing staff and food!  When I visited I was comped my cinnamon buns and coffee.  The manager was really nice and the staff was friendly.  The food was amazing the best cinnamon bun I have ever had!!

q4rDLii1cgUk-NzOPUWcXA.text: Sometimes okay. Kids love to come here for the sweet sugar cinnamon rolls, but customer service is lacking. The teens behind the counter always seem to be bothered by paying customers.

_93rJRYYpmty7vye4CjKKw.text: Great stuff! Lots of different toppings! You're able to customize to your liking and you get a pretty big cinnamon roll for your money.

v-p8dbROzSUues3_lZbjiA.text: First time at Cinnaholic today. One word: AMAZING! The only negative reviews I read have been that the rolls are "too sweet". It's a CINNAMON ROLL! They're suppose to be sweet lol! I chose the peanut butter frosting and bananas and peanut butter cups as toppings. I'm a bit of a peanut butter snob but the frosting was great, and the peanut butter cups were soft and tasted like chocolate peanut butter fudge. I will be back with the family ASAP! Good job Cinnaholic

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Amazing

Q0igX5fnx5-ig3M-y4aRDQ.text: Waaaaaaaayyyyyy better than Cinnabon. So many flavors to choose from and you're able to try as many as you want before making a decision. It's a little overwhelming how many GOOD options they are. Get 2 or 3 at a time!! You won't be disappointed!

DHLYT5RfI4RHn8cysfwbqw.text: My only complaint is that I couldn't afford six of these bad boys to take home.  While this place isn't super obvious as a vegan spot, it's become a legend in the CLT vegan community.  Don't go thinking that makes it healthy, or anything, but enjoy!  We got a vanilla frosted banana topped with Carmel as well as a cream cheese frosted with strawberry jam.  Both were excellent but I would personally recommend the banana! They were a little difficult to eat and I can imagine if it gets crowded on a weekend it wouldn't be fun to battle the small space but we had no trouble and loved every bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cream cheese frosting and strawberry jam
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Vanilla frosting, bananas and caramel

dMPcgd-pC_7orM3SPuSrQw.text: We loved treating ourselves to something unique with the family. The kids loved customizing their rolls (which of course meant Oreos on everything) and watching their faces when they saw their creation. Everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Her request was to customize the Carmel with Oreos on top

TuLCD4oE-yyd7SIo9ksu6g.text: I want to eat here every day for the rest of my life. Waited in life for about an hour but it was definitely worth it. This place is inexpensive and a 10/10 EVERYTIME

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

TeipE_sGk7jh6PKB-8S6ag.text: The cookie monster taste good lots of sugar  well worth the additional 10 min wait. After an attempt to visit during their grand opening, I made it my business to drive 42 mins for the sugar rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

mj3o2cqYHFKYfdyzqVsjCA.text: You can get custom cinnabuns based on your preference of glaze, topping, etc.  Plus other stuff.   And they are tasty too!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

AQRgrTKpwSYwLd-YcWO9-A.text: Best vegan cinnamon roll I've ever had. Best all around cinnamon roll I've ever had. So soft so delicious. Great customer service here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

l9k4gmZBNNvf06ND3sUrWw.text: Best place ever! My boyfriend and I come here all the time and the staff is so wonderful. Cinnamon rolls are delicious and all vegan  we love y'all

Oa7HRgDinIwbcaYJ8hBGXg.text: Delicious! Customize your own or partake in the selections they have created. Similar to an ice cream parlor. There are so many topping choices and they even let me sample things before I designed my own Cinnamon bun. With all that being fabulous already, I think what really impressed me was that everything was vegan. The flavor was more delicious than any non vegan cinnamon bun I have had. What people may not know, is vegan products usually have less ingredients and more natural ingredients making food more vibrant in flavor and healthier. I am not a vegan by declaration but I sure do enjoy vegan food and these vegan cinnamon buns are AMAZING!!

Cgx9_x8mNZ7Oa_pCgUzrVA.text: For almost $5 I had a cinnamon bun that tasted like Pillsbury biscuit dough with a thick slab of Pillsbury icing. I so wanted this to be a fantastic experience.

8_sNApVJEEscW4VJpf3c3w.text: The Buns are tasty by my goodness people.  $5+ for this.  Are you kidding me? No I guess not by the number of people I see spending their money on this.  Learn to bake people! For $5 you can  purchase enough flour, sugar and cinnamon spice to make dozens and dozens of your own home baked deliciousness.  My congrats to the founders of Cinnaholic and their franchisees to understand their target market and serve them well.

xzuoiyXj9xCSI0ypqYz3zQ.text: The cinnamon rolls were good but not for the price. The icing ended up in the box. Disappointed having to scrap icing out of the box.

xuvTbNB47YKru3UP76em5Q.text: I've heard great things about this place, and trust me everything I heard was True. Amazing Cinnamon Rolls with such delicious flavors and creative looks. The overall look inside was very intriguing. The Employees were very nice, As a first timer I usually like to be informed on the product and the Employees did not disappoint. Other than that I really enjoyed it there, you won't be disappointed. Also I got the Cookie Monster and it was excellent!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

26LR9Qnm_v4fCVCz5P0tHg.text: Experienced racism by gentleman taking orders yesterday.   He notified everyone before me and after me of the wait time of 6 minutes and asked them if that was OK for them and if they mind waiting.  When he took my order he NEVER gave me the same courtesy he provided to them.  Being intelligent and not jumping to conclusions,  I thought to myself maybe everyone before me ordered something different. So I asked, 'whats the wait time'? He responded 5 to 6 minutes or so.  Never asked he if I mind waiting or that work for ME.  So I stepped back and observed him taking orders after mine. Just to be sure. And again they were provided an explanation and an option.  I was the only African American in the store.  I haven't experienced selective racism in a long time.  For the record I love ALL people and we are raising our children to love ALL people.  And we (my family) and I will unapologeticly call out and expose any form of racism we experience, especially at an establishment where we spend our money.  $75 per week at this establishment for example. When you know better you will do better..

psVEK_HCAXHtXk8brfWHdA.text: OMG!!! This place is super clean.. the staff is super nice... And the desserts are out of this world... Very addicting.... I wish I lived closer... I recommend this place

WDOJ_GI7-N9_62osLMOURg.text: As soon as we walked in, I didn't get that warm, delicious cinnamon aroma that captures you when you're in the mall near Cinnabon. They do have a good selection of flavors and toppings unlike Cinnabon, but their actual cinnamon bun underwhelmed and lacked in that ooey gooeyness you very from a Cinnabon cinnamon bun.

4hg7V2T42cKmFgJDkSS_pQ.text: Fruit was fresh, rolls were hot, what more could I ask for??  Amazing service, came here when they opened and they were very busy but all had smiles on their faces. Vegan or not, this place is awesome and their chocolate chip cookies are to die for!

13wVm_yYSFcVARgVq_kTRg.text: I went to cinnaholic to get sweet treats for my staff! They were all amazing & we will definitely be back for more!! Yummm!!! Highly recommend!

IGLGPHEjfmbu9DbfrrXtqA.text: Definitely not to miss for a vegan but still a nice splurge if you just have a sweet tooth. Not cheap but worth the quality. Lots of topping options and made to order. Warm and gooey!

VW3Wn-E-0lJtjfdWljB1tw.text: Are you vegan!? Then welcome to heaven! Not Vegan? Then get ready to pay airport prices for a sugar coma. This place is really only worth it if you're Vegan.  The classic roll is absolutely delicious by itself and doesn't need extra toppings. The starting price of $4.75 is extremely high in my opinion. I added fresh strawberries to my order this time and they put about 4 pieces of chopped strawberry ??? So for an extra .75 cents I didn't even receive the equivalent of (1) whole strawberry -_-  I'm not vegan, so I don't feel the need to waste my money on the simple novelty of being able to eat an all plant based dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

LpfKvRaoDk8c3sXu4JC1-A.text: First time i've eaten at a new concept that originated from a pitch on the show Shark Tank!  These guys are on to something! The flavors/toppings that go with these buns are fantastic! You would never know everything is 100% vegan!   My first try, i got the "Strawberry Shortcake" (cream cheese spread, strawberries and cookie crumble). It was delicious! They have several spread/topping options. You can create your own or choose from one of their classic creations.  Right now, they're only located in Indian trail but I've heard from staff that they are planning on expanding to Charlotte in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

fI_A6iRDzOL2ZNBC5EQ3SQ.text: Soooo yummy!!! The cinnamon rolls are huge and the icing can be a bit overwhelming.  You definitely get what you pay for and it's a plus that you can save some for later. The customer service is also top-notch. --The only negative is the wait time.  On average, the wait is about 7-10 minutes, and that increases because the lines are so long.  Timing is everything with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

cImvME9nTE5Nzqy0fsgcPw.text: We were SO excited about trying this place out. We drove almost an hour for this special treat. It was super busy, but that was to be expected and not a big deal. We ordered 4 different cinnamon rolls and three of us ate them. Unfortunately... Two of them ended up in the trash and we managed to somewhat eat the others. We are plant based and used to eating things without dairy/animal products... So I wasn't expecting a miracle.. just a yummy treat.   The cream cheese frosting just has a funky taste, almost like fake banana? The brownies were hard and also thrown away :(. The almond frosting was... yuck!!! The best one out of the four was the maple Frosting with cookie dough and caramel. So so sad. If I had to do it again, I'd order a plain cinnamon roll. The middle of the rolls were fine and I did eat that part after I took the toppings off.  We also were charged for an extra cinnamon roll that we didn't order. Thankfully before we left and reviewed the receipt we were able to go back, and they said they credited our account. So again, not a big deal.  The place is super cute and the display case makes you want to order everything - but the taste test failed to impress.  Price: Base price was $4.75, to get a frosting is an additional $0.25, and each topping is $0.50.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Maple frosting with cookie dough and caramel.
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Almond frosting with cookie dough
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Caramel frosting with brownie bites

uTVDHoBCyGBTjbxhBF4Kgg.text: I drive 30m out just for this!!! So happy I don't have to go to the mall anymore and get pimples from the dairy lol So good!!!! My only recommendation is to make sure everyone is greeted when they walk in the door. Great customer service will go a long way!!!

u1m5UiFLHlPufaHRg37f3g.text: Worth The Wait!  Vegans Rejoice!  This spot was everything you hoped for and more.  Deliciousness overload with these create your own cinnamon rolls.  We tried the peanut butter frosting with banana topping.  We also tried the banana cream frosting with banana & caramel sauce topping.  The lattes are even Vegan, you can chose from almond or soy milk.  It is worth the drive...definitely a great spot for breakfast or dessert.  Follow me @ #foodievida on Facebook and Instagram for more of my foodie adventures.

bSWwxZv6SgV9fUa8gm4LTw.text: Glad we are finally getting different eating establishments in Indian Trail.  Purchased the Cookie Monster roll.  Pretty delicous.  Pretty pricey too at almost $6 a roll with tax.  -1 Star for the whole ordering process.  It doesn't seem to foster quickness, but that could be because they just opened as well.  It's worth trying at least once to see if it's your thing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

5Yin2OrQvHS4XiYudPrUXw.text: Came in around 4pm on a Saturday and there were a lot of people in there, but no line. We got a Cookie Monster and then a custom strawberry icing & Oreo cookie topping cinnamon roll. Both were amazing & very fast friendly service.  The best part is that everything is VEGAN! Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cookie Monster &amp; Strawberry icing with Oreos. Vegan delicious-ness!!

2vb1zaoxPrr4b5Uy75t1-Q.text: Found this place because of yelp. If I cannot convince you to do anything else for the rest of your life, let me convince you of one thing: these cinnamon rolls are INCREDIBLE.

p2vGr29g0qPZymVlNRhZZA.text: Amazing place! Custom made. Friendly and fast service. A great choice for cinnamon rolls. They can be customized any way you want them. That makes them unique. They crush Cinnabun.

zrUnQBAdbxaoFQmFWexOWQ.text: Very surprised to say I think these blow Cinnabon out of the water. They're huge, made fresh and customized will all your favorite toppings...I mean, what's not to love??! The first step is picking your own ICING, come on now!! Think there were about fifteen flavors. We went with a cream cheese and banana cream...yum. Second step is selecting as many wonderful toppings your little heart desires: cookie dough, sauces, pretzels, fresh fruits...it's ridic   They have other items as well; brownies, cookies. We also tried the edible cookie dough with s'mores topping. Was overly sweet for me personally, but I just housed the CR and saved this one for my husband.   They're advertised as gourmet CRs which is spot on and they're also vegan (I would've never know). The CRs are pricey at $4.75 + $.50 per topping, but 100% worth it. Basically licked my container clean and I know we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

zs6VncQPqRCVn6WNWGCmsQ.text: Oh my gosh- This place is amazing! My first thought was "how good can a vegan cinnamon roll really be?"... well one of the best I've ever had! I got the birthday cake icing with cookie dough topping and it was delicious. My sister got the peanut butter icing on her cinnamon roll and loved it. This place a legit!

2YhbONVnU6PrKeLpdVNuVA.text: We went around 7 PM on Sunday and the place was packed with line wrapping in the store.  They do get things out quickly once you order - I think it took under 5 minutes to get ours. I had the hazelnut icing with "oreos" and pie crumble.  My husband had the peanut butter icing with strawberries and bananas.  We both thought they were good and we did not think they were too sweet.  My friend got the vanilla icing with cookie dough and chocolate drizzle and it was too sweet for her to finish eating.  I would suggest if getting the cookie dough maybe avoiding the vanilla icing as people seem to have been commenting it is too sweet. The cinnamon rolls were warm and gooey - I didn't find that they were dry as some have commented.  I'll definetely be back and look forward to the other proposed Charlotte openings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Peanut butter icing with strawberries and bananas
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Hazelnut icing with Oreo and pie crumble

5t2ruiR-R13tgTvmweCibA.text: The cinnamon rolls are really good but VERY sweet. Even just a basic roll with icing is sweet. I'd recommend this place if you like super sweet treats. The only thing I do not like is the variety of beverages.

ZFJdQdmTanUV9QVU5TCTQg.text: First time in. Ordered 3 regular size. Had to wait because there were none ready. Place was not busy. Ate them when we got home and although very tasty, not sure we'd spend $5+ each on cinnamon bun again.

HdeQW3Gkw6xIzzYPs0JU-w.text: This place is awesome! Loved the banana caramel cinnamon roll with sprinkled almonds. Loved the fact that it was dairy free. Even the presentation was nice! I would have taken a picture but before I knew it, it was gone! Definitely will be back.

_CDry2YtkgdNqPhe-FzQVA.text: I am glad there is a cinnamon roll place in the Indian Trail area. Close location to a lot of us who do not want to drive 30-40 minutes to a Cinnabon. I'd say that despite being Vegan, and tasting slightly different, it is still delicious. Cinnaholic is a little more pricey. Mainly because there is a charge for each topping you add. I ended up paying about $7 for my roll yesterday. They do have a lot of toppings to choose from so at least you won't get bored of just one or two options. There are several table/chairs inside and one bathroom. They do offer complimentary water which is always good. I'll def be coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cream cheese, strawberries, pecan, and caramel sauce (added after pic).

RWanHMvfrdBd2v-sfrKZBQ.text: Personally thought it wasn't worth the hype or the money. Won't go back. Plus waited too long after we ordered and it wasn't that busy.

3W4EFJ5nB8Na5hhHLcCdhg.text: The owners are a very thoughtful and everything is so perfectly sweet. I love coming back here as often as possible  Thank you for being in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. the cinnamon cookies are amazing! and this Maple with walnuts and pie crust was to die for

s47KqQVGnEX-f9uN15AXLA.text: Need that taste treat, or something before the movie?? They have it and amazing taste!! Found this after lunch nearby. Should have skipped lunch and went straight to Cinnaholic!!

niYUOywzdv4iOs2Nmo7WCw.text: Very nice staff + Delicious food  = a perfect place to grab a treat!    I enjoy the strawberry lemonade offered in the summer!

vn5-x9jncD_PkKfxjykLsw.text: There were so many delicious options! All the workers were extremely patient and well-versed with the menu. And the store is very clean!!  You choose your icing, then the toppings [you pay for each topping] So yes, the cinnamon rolls can get a little pricey once you add toppings.   I loved that they offered day old rolls for a discount. The to go cup of icing is more than enough, you only use about half a container for each roll. When you have a large family like myself this was the most cost-effective way to enjoy the cinnamon rolls.  We will definitely be visiting here again, can't go wrong when the cinnamon rolls are vegan! FYI- they may be lil sweet for some.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

13dAP1XfEqJr9v6w8MC01A.text: This place is genius! I've been wanting to try this place because for one it's vegan and two I've been hearing such great things about it before it hit North Carolina. I'm so happy to be able to say we have one. The cinnamon rolls are amazing. You can create your own for a base price of $4.25 and then choice of frosting is .25 cents and each topping is .50 cents. I got the create your own and got the cream cheese frosting with strawberries. The berries were very fresh and the consistency of the frosting was perfect as well as the cinnamon bun melting in your mouth.  The cinnamon roll isn't to rich or sweet, it doesn't cause you to feel full or fell like you overindulge when you normally eat a cinnamon roll. I definitely will be back. They offer cookie dough,and brownies as well. They also have a wild selection drinks as well to wash down your cinnamon bun. Oh and Everything is vegan.   There is a reward system for you to sign up for and you get a free cinnamon bun for your next visit when signing up for loyalty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

dWsvJGB9ABkP7ubbzVPRiw.text: Vegan. Custom. Sweet. Savory.   It's nearly impossible for me to give less than five stars to an all vegan dessert establishment. Im told cinnaholic was on shark Tank and I must say if I had seen the pitch I too would have bought in.   When you walk in the space is small but it's really all they need. You get the option to build your own cinnamon bun with choices in your icing and then your toppings. I sing options include peanut butter, Carmel, almond, orange glaze, vanilla, chocolate, mint, cream, strawberry, cream cheese... You get the picture. Now we're onto the toppings and that list is even longer than you can imagine from Oreos to nuts, from sweet things to salty things you take your pick. You will have a fear of making a bad decision, but I just don't think it's possible!   They also offer healthy dairy free drink options, teas and coffee... I have a mad amount of respect for companies that don't push sodas.   If you're living in Charlotte and your curious if this place is worth the drive the answer is yes and if you need a friend to go with you I'll gladly meet you there... It's so good and I am a vegan with a raging sweet tooth so how can I not love as good vegan cinnamon bun?!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

KbAnhYkh4GFESgFoXGuWwA.text: Cinnaholic has been on my radar for a while... if you follow them on instagram, you'll know why.  It is a little bit "removed" from Charlotte... but for a short drive, the payoff is well worth it if you have a friend that's vegan or you yourself are one, the vegan options in Charlotte are few and far between.  This location is in Wesley Chapel, which has been experiencing a lot of growth lately.  The shopping center is fairly new... I think I only knew it as a movie theater location, but it's good to see more buildings and businesses are filling in around it.  Walked in during the afternoon and the nice lady at the register greeted us and gave us the spiel on how everything worked with the menu.  A few minutes later, we were gorging ourselves with cinnamon rolls.  Probably could have shared one, but I figured since we came all the way out there... may as well try 2 different rolls.  Tried the original - YUM and their cookie monster.... which ended up being super decadent and heavy... but if you are a fan of cookie dough, this will not disappoint.    The shop is a typical size strip mall shop... a handful of tables around.  There were some teenagers hanging out in the corner.... I guess this is the 2018 version of Dairy Queen when I was growing up.  Water is available, but they also carry other choices for drinks in a cooler.  Their display case had Avengers: Infinity War inspired concoctions... which I thought was novel.  Overall a great experience... I would come back to try their thousands of combinations when you customize a roll or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Drink options
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cookie Monster
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Pickup

_zjM9odjSXGbl_UPAxCbmQ.text: When I heard this place was opening, I sat, and watched, and waited. I told everyone I knew about this vegan cinnamon roll place! So when they opened I made firm plans to get there, come Hell or high water.  Well...I guess I should've factored in miles because for as long as they've been opened, today was my first visit. I literally had planned workouts around their opening, it was that serious.   So I walk in today and you'd think I had never seen ANY of their Instagram posts of all of the yummy toppings because I stood there in complete awe and confusion about what to order.  I had to pick up one for my partner so I kept it simple with cream cheese frosting and pretzels. She loved it! Mine was the same frosting but wit brownie bites! It was difficult not to eat the entire thing in one sitting, but I managed.  I say all of that to say...get one, or two. Now!

PHaDGHY_l16t1HOMW4EdHQ.text: I went opening weekend and the line was wrapped around inside. (as expected) I waited about 30 minutes in line.  The ordering system they have set up seemed pretty efficient as I got my cinnamon buns in less than 5 minutes after I ordered! (And fresh out the oven)   It seemed if an order had an extended wait, it was because the buns were baking.  I got a tub of cookie dough out the fridge they have, two custom cinnamon buns and a cup of oat milk. (I wanted unsweetened almond milk but they only have sweetened or chocolate option for almond)  (I am not vegan, by the way) I thought the buns were good, just a bit dry.  I was a bit disappointed because the buns were so hot and I was ready for a nice warm moist bite!!   I built my bun with Horchata frosting and topped it with almonds and blue berries.  The Horchata frosting was amazing!  The second bun in my party had regular frosting with caramel syrup and brownie bites. It was very sweet to me, but I don't normally get caramel things. The cookie dough seemed sweet to me as well.  The staff was friendly. Almost everyone thanked me for waiting and stopping by.  I had a 40 minute drive - don't think I'll get a craving and feel the need to out my way to come by but if I'm ever on that side of town again - count me in! (I love cinnamon rolls)

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

SXVGDPb4iN2j6wbwVhjxMA.text: Dear goodness where has Cinnaholic been all my life. I had one of their premade cinnamon rolls with coffee frosting, chocolate chips and caramel sauce.  The store was clean and the man behind the counter was very helpful to this first timer that was quite overwhelmed with all the choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Coffee frosting, chocolate chips, marshmallows, and caramel sauce topped a cinnamon roll.

o9xZ85qU3CwP-R4Og0ABWQ.text: I finally stopped by after stalking them in Instagram for a while! My mom was visiting and we were in the area. Plus I knew she would appreciate the sweet treats.   Ok so it's kind of overwhelming for a first timer. There are so many different options and you don't know which to choose or what combo to create. But everyone here was so nice and extremely helpful. They explained everything and advised us of popular combinations. They even offered to let us try any of the frostings.   We finally made a few decisions and they did not disappoint. We ended with 3 custom buns and 2 of the cookie dough. What a hit!

cpDvMSFXt4OifWxnp-7NPA.text: Great place for when you're in the mood for something sweet. The cinnamon rolls are a nice size with so many flavors combinations to pick from. My cousin from NY loved it when I first brought him in December. He needed up going again twice when he came back to NC in June.

Arb3uqfmrJlfvkN27yDqaQ.text: We had this delivered for the office and what a display it was!  Very colorful and looks appetizing. It was a little too rich for my taste but it may be because we ordered such a large quantity.  I'll have to try their individual pastries. Until next time....

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Sweetness overload!
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Very pretty
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Happy Hump Day!

0ZO0tzTi0U4YfRssS8xMNw.text: I love this place! The choices can be overwhelming, but I haven't had anything I didn't like. Their cinnamon rolls are amazing! Not being able to tolerate dairy makes this place my favorite for desserts that don't upset my stomach.   The blueberry cinnamon roll that comes with "cream cheese" icing is my favorite. While I wish they had a location in southpark close to me, my body is thankful they don't!  Also, every single time I've been in they are so friendly and helpful!

iJ711mY_82XPiEsw0Q9O3g.text: Wow -- my husband and I were blown away from start to finish with their service, the atmosphere, and the taste of their cinnamon rolls -- my goodness their cinnamon rolls were PHENOMENAL!!! We tried the Cookie Monster (so so good) and one of their specials that their manager recommended which was called the Wanderer. They were both to die for!! Not only was the food delicious, but the manager that helped us was so helpful in that she explained how the ordering process worked as it was our first time, and also made sure that we had cold water, and even got us our utensils after bringing us our rolls. Such great service and just such a great atmosphere to hang out and enjoy such a great product! They also offered free WiFi and had some board games and chess available for entertainment. Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place to anyone -- especially due to the fact that this place is completely vegan which is why we were drawn to cinnaholic in the first place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cookie Monster
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Wanderer

F0hAU2PweTMnOSDArvUOaQ.text: If you're in the mood for something sweet you definitely want to stop in at Cinnaholic.  With over 15 different flavors of frosting and several different toppings you can create your own masterpiece of a cinnamon roll! They also have cookie dough by the scoop too. And what pairs nicely with those two scrumptious treats, you ask? That's right... Locally roasted coffee. After your next dinner and movie drop in at Cinnaholic. You won't be disappointed!

UbZ7NaGIzDdyCtuLQK5_2Q.text: Delicious cinnamon rolls! So much to chose from. The staff is very nice, patient and helpful. The store is very clean and in a good spot. Wish ( maybe not) they were closer to me.

8ty0LWI4xnzYkHceoZEATA.text: vegan! Yahoo! This place is delicious and a cozy atmosphere with very friendly helpful staff I will be back again

VuDExu2Nmo9QrEKi4heuOg.text: Last night we were across the way at Sun Valley 14 to see Green Book.  When we came out, Cinnaholic was closed.  And I fretted and frowned.   The amazing, wonderful, loving and patient mother that I was given, tired from a long day at work, agreed to make the drive back this evening.  True to her word , we made the 20min drive along Old Charlotte.  On a rainy night no less. Upon entry, we were greeted by a charming young woman with a gracious smile and she was genuine.  Mind was already made up having scoured through all of the photos on yelp last night and today.  Already knew what I wanted. 1) Old Skool for dad, and 2) Hazelnut with Fresh Strawberries and Almonds.  Really I was prepared to treat all of us, but mom claimed she didn't want one (that's code for : I'm going to eat some of yours).   Only 2 more days before returning to the West Coast, maybe I can squeeze in One More visit before Monday. By the time we made it back to the house, they were still warm, surprisingly.  Though I had to give it an honorary nuke for no more than 10 seconds.  It was perfect. Not to sweet, light, fluffy and First Day Fresh.  If only they had one of these in USC Village or dtla, everything would be right with the world.  Thank you again to the gracious young woman. With Gratitude and Blessings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Hot Chocolate with Almond Milk ¿  Yes, Please.
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Self Explanatory

93cEBctXwQQxs_KVsLe0Qg.text: Oh my where has the this place been all my life lol Its all things cinnamon rolls , you order your cinnamon roll than add your frosting an than add some blueberries or cookie dough . They do have day old cinnamon rolls for a dollar which I ordered . I got vanilla frosting an added hazelnut frosting oh my it was so good. Did I mention they are vegan not sure about the calories but it was so good . You want desert don't go to McDonalds or dairy queen go to cinnaholic you wont regret it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

HX43XYzv4ysByMLICEnrvA.text: We initially discovered this place in Dallas, TX about a year ago so when we found out it was coming to Charlotte, we were thrilled! Soon as it touched down, we were right there... in line... building our own cinnamon roll. It's basically your Chiptole of cinnamon rolls, just vegan and the best part of it all is it doesn't even taste vegan at all!!! I'm not a vegan so coming from me says a lot lol. The staff is always friendly, place is clean and the playlist is awesome!  The only downfall to this place is the location. It's not in the heart of Charlotte and I'm not sure how they even found this location in Indian trail, but if it was closer to Charlotte's metro area then a lot more people would be there! We drive about 30-35 min one way just to enjoy a vegan cinnamon roll... but then again it's probably a good thing because if it was closer, then I'd be eating the m waaaaay often than I need to.   Overall, great concept, a good dessert and less fattening(maybe lol---- dairy/egg free). Sounds like a winner to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Endless topping options

LWYZ3-8-7PTMtAO_ecfRvg.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet as I've been 5 times already was even here for the Grand Opening $1 Roll event.  I LOVE this place, I follow the business on FB as they won Shark Tank and is based West Coast. Imagine the joy I felt once I read they were coming to NC and being Vegan it was even more exciting as I don't get many Vegan GOOD dessert choices here. I don't eat dessert often but when I do I would like something tasty and memorable.  This place fits the bill both tasty and memorable. There are so many options and combinations you can do with the icing flavor and the toppings that you will keep coming back to try the next and the next and the next (at least that's my excuse for multiple visits plus I've taken out of town guest.  This place was a madhouse my first 3 visits as it was still SUPER new. It was a little better as far as crowd by visit 4 and super easy in and out on visit 5 which was this past weekend.  I enjoyed the Queen City roll on grand opening day and our toddler had the Birthday cake roll which he gets every visit now. My husband favorite is orange icing with walnuts. I've had lemon and coconut as well as vanilla and almonds.  Overall this place is a keeper

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Hours
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Face Painting while we wait

TfpbUrksispYWRs_lN8d_g.text: My family loves these sticky buns. They love The topping choices and how they don't taste overly sweet; that just means they eat one easily in one sitting. I like that they use simple ingredients. I think some topics are overly priced (like A tablespoon of pecans). However, I get it. We'll keep returning when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Display shout outs teachers and back to school. Vegan certificate
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Top is oreos with marshmallow  Bottom is lemon cream and cookie dough
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Order counter

4Yy0TMfrkhpOIxSr1dbTtA.text: Move over Cinnabon! Cinnaholic is the New Young Thunder Cat on the outskirts of Charlotte.   With over 20 unique frosting flavors, plus a wide assortment of toppings, Cinnaholic is instantly winning the hearts of everyone. This isn't your average cinnamon roll shop. Whether you're on a vegan diet or not you can't go wrong with eating these cinnamon rolls.   All their products are made with the highest quality ingredients and are 100% plant-based! GASP! Dairy & lactose-free, egg-free and cholesterol-free.....GASP again....Vegan and delish? Yes, Way.   My recommendations: Raspberry Dream (The REMIX):  Chocolate frosting, Huge lump of cookie dough, Fresh raspberries, almonds, chocolate sauce.  Birthday Cake: Cake batter Frosting, marshmallows, and colorful sprinkles. Southern Apple Pie: Maple frosting, Apple, pie crumbles, pecans, caramel sauce. Mocha Mocha: Coffee frosting, Mocha ice cream, coffee dust, chocolate sauce. Chai Latte: Chai and marshmallow frosting, pecans, coffee dust. Sweet Summer Lemonade: Lemon Frosting, strawberry ice cream, coconut  The Raspberry Dream (REMIX) was my favorite, I loved the fresh fruit topping.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Sweet Summer Lemonade: Lemon Frosting, strawberry ice cream, coconut
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Mocha Mocha: Coffee frosting, Mocha ice cream, coffee dust, chocolate sauce.
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Raspberry Dream (The REMIX), TWO Chai Lattes, Birthday Cake, Southern Apple Pie

CmF5yhRcjbeSd2-xNQ0xfw.text: I am very picky about sweets, when you eat processed desserts, it leaves a weird film on your tongue afterwards. So when I was meeting people at Cinnaholic, I was not too enthused, I was going to be social.   They looked amazing, I was still in 'this could be a bunch of fake stuff mode.' I tasted the ooey gooey rolls, wait..... they did not have that weird after taste. I stand corrected.  After talking on Instagram later, I found out  100% Vegan, dairy free, lactose free, egg free, cholesterol free and you can top it with dairy free gelato from Artisen. (Equdorian gelato, shop in Matthews)   If I would have known this before hand I might have been a little judgey because I do love some butter. But I would rather have this cinnamon roll over chain or pop out of can.   Tip: get icing on the side and reheat at home for take away.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

m7Q4wKoChS1viukgugXmkQ.text: On my first trip I was not comparing apples to apples. I did not realize this was a vegan bakery! I still was not a huge fan of the classic but I was comparing it to a dairy filled roll.  This time I went for a topped roll and got the peach cobbler. It was very good. It had peaches, pecans a crumble and vanilla frosting.   I split it with my wife and it was plenty and we both enjoyed it.   I also got the iced coffee with vanilla almond milk. So good. The coffee is worth stopping by.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Iced Coffee
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Peach Cobbler
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Lots of examples

AxcX5Z4u0xLLA0O0mGkhMQ.text: "As seen on Shark Tank..." this little wonder is tucked quietly in the sleepy town of Indian Trail.  Both of which are screaming to be enjoyed and frequented.  Cinnaholic is a truly unique place that offers a build your own cinnamon bun that is actually, drum roll please, vegan.  I'm not a vegan, I have no desire to be a vegan but this place makes me reconsider.    When you walk in there is a gigantic menu board where you order the classic roll, choose from an array of icing and even more toppings to "top it all off".  If you're not sure or not the adventurous type, they have recommendations hanging around the shop or stick with the 'ol Classic.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Display case
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Menu and coffee machine

oC1Gx1vardW4EdRuHPLfbQ.text: This place is a solid 3 1/2 stars if I could give. You can create your own delicious treat that can be vegan! It's a welcoming place that appears clean. They have cookies and Cinnamon rolls. The price is contingent upon the toppings you choose and the amount of toppings. They are paperless. The only issue is they do not give paper receipts. You can give your phone number or email. Both are dangerous to give because I gave my email for a receipt and now I get emails all the time. I attempted to unsubscribe, but they keep coming. It's so annoying. A friend put her number and following it she gets texts. When I pushed to get my receipt on their tablet I know I checked for fine print to ensure I un-checked the small font box so they would not contact me and they still do. So be prepared just to not have a receipt or be annoyed. I understand the whole go green thing, but if you are please don't spam me! The chocolate chip cookie was good. Other then the receipt issue it is nice to try. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

rXA__XI7wwbaWtAqRhLRLA.text: Cinnabon step aside, there's a new sheriff in town. Cinnaholic has been open for 7 months now here in Charlotte and is the new big wave. It's a build your own cinnamon roll shop with a huge variety of options from icings and toppings you can get your creative on with. I rolled with the classic cream cheese icing, gobs of cookie dough, and peanut butter cups. According to the owner of the shop, Michelle, this combination is a first that she's ever seen and she told me she will definitely be making that again for herself after work. It sure was delicious, and I enjoyed every bite of the soft, sweet cinnamon roll. Their dough is prepped every 3-4 hours and the cinnamon rolls take 20 minutes to make. If any cinnamon rolls are left sitting out for over 30 minutes, they toss them and prepare new ones to keep the freshness for their customers. That's why my cinnamon roll was so soft. Cinnaholic employees quality control everything they serve taste testing what they put out. (Don't let me work here, I'll become the cinnamon roll monster.) This idea originated on Sharktank and now has become a nationwide franchise. They also just opened some locations in Canada as well. Immediately after crushing my cin, I had to go back up to the counter to create another masterpiece. My second cin was topped with peanut butter icing, fresh banana slices, and Oreo cookies. Michelle was very enthusiastic and loved what she did. She was proud on the fact that everything they offer is made from scratch every morning including the peanut butter cups that I devoured. This place is 100% vegan, but they don't advertise that loudly. There's a small sticker in the corner of the pickup counter glass window stating it's vegan and that's about it. They offer specialty flavors according to season if you choose not to customize your own, but please do customize as that's the fun part. Sweet tooth lovers go find your way to Cinnaholic.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Vanilla icing w/ brownies and chocolate chip cookies.
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Peanut butter icing w/ bananas and cookie dough.

Tyu7HsqXxu38tG486J5fDg.text: Who doesn't love a warm cinnamon roll freshly baked and topped with delicious items of your choice? Well I don't know anyone. I stumbled upon this place by accident and was pleasantly surprised.   It's literally in the middle of no where. I'm sad that it's so far from my house. Parking is easy though and it wasn't super busy. The staff was nice and helpful.  I ordered the maple icing and pie crumble topping. The roll came out as warm as ever and it melted in my mouth. It was so good. I can't wait to come back and try some other options. They also have mini rolls and cookies!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Maple with Pie Crumble

cqmMxkeySQHNoYJI0nYc3Q.text: Gosh. These rolls are so good.   I was excited to finally get to check this place off my bookmarks. First, this place smells amazing when you walk in the door! Second, you can pretty much make up any combination you want...I love that!   I kept it simple this time and just got the Old School and added chocolate drizzle. It arrived warm and was so good. I couldn't resist taking a bite before I snapped a picture.   Delicious!  I can't wait to go back and try another one. Also, grab a day old roll to go and enjoy it at home!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Old School (sorry it looked too delicious...I had to take a bite!)

-E26UoGErMactWdHY40mcA.text: While I haven't been to another location, this Cinnaholic is doing something right! I love being able to order a cinnamon roll with toppings of my choice. The ingredients are fresh and it is hard to believe everything is completely vegan! Highly recommend stopping by to grab a sweet treat and a coffee!

WoSgS8RuzWT6AVg_dToBag.text: I can never keep my cinnamon rolls around long enough to take a pic to post. This place is amazing. I have a friend who can't eat dairy because her newborn has an allergy. I stumbled on this place from seeing an instagram post from a blogger, and it's been the best thing. My friend is addicted and now so am I....well now I'm not so sure finding this place is a good thing after all lol. This is how cinnamon rolls should be done! It's a little pricey, but once you have Cinnaholic you're cinnamon roll expectations will be on a whole different level. The coffee dust cookie dough is a hit too, and the customer service is great! The only con is how far out it is  (which still hasn't stopped us from coming). We travel from Concord to Indian Trail because they often have specials that you can't pass up.

Etkbz65wZjLA5Hzo3xk9rQ.text: Positives: -Concept - it's cool you can customize your cinnamon roll to your liking. -Variety - there are over ten different frostings and over 15 different toppings to choose from. They have fruit or more sweet things like cookie dough. -Staff/store - friendly staff. Everyone had a smile on their face. The store was clean and tidy.  Negatives: -Price - starting out the cinnamon roll is almost $5. Each topping is $.50. For two cinnamon rolls, a green tea and coffee, it was $19. -Taste - maybe because I'm not vegan, I wasn't a fan. I thought the cinnamon roll itself was bland. The toppings weren't very good either. We ended up throwing our cinnamon rolls away after only two bites. We tried the blueberry Pie and cookie dough.  Based on price and taste alone, if you're not vegan, I'd eat a regular cinnamon roll with all the good stuff. For those that are vegan, it's a nice option for a sweet breakfast treat!   Tip: if you don't like a lot of frosting, ask for lite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Blueberry Pie
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Blueberry Pie

SRsYn3WH_C8vi03tgI8gKw.text: Oh. My. God. Charlotte Agenda hyped this place up and it totally lived up to it. This is definitely the best dessert I've ever had.   I did a custom cinnamon roll with peanut butter and raspberry icings and marshmallows, strawberry, banana, raspberries, and pie crumble for toppings. It was incredible. The cinnamon roll was gooey and delicious.   There are tons of toppings and icing flavors to choose from. If you're too overwhelmed, they also have premade combinations you can try.  I had a bite of my husband's and friends and they were both amazing as well.   Everything is vegan, but you would never know. I'm not vegan and they were the best cinnamon rolls I've ever had.   I can't wait for them to open up a location closer to Charlotte! It's definitely worth the drive all the way out here. I highly recommend making the trip out to try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cinnamon roll with cake batter and caramel icings, marshmallows, strawberries, raspberries, pie crumble, and caramel sauce
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cinnamon roll with chai and maple icings, caramel sauce, marshmallows, pie crumble, and pecans
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cookie dough with caramel and cake batter icings, marshmallows, graham crackers, and caramel sauce

GzGXPvqKA5zkDAKVY12sqg.text: Fantastic Mexican food. I'm from New York and we have only one place that comes close to this. The ground beef is perfectly seasoned and the free chips were warm with plentiful salsa.  Its definitely worth going. The curb appeal of the place shouldn't even be considered when choosing to come here.

GnzyrhEw8EPPCiTWX-PlNg.text: Phenomenal dessert treats with melt-in-your-mouthful flavors! We loved the toppings--the flavor combination I chose was peanut butter frosting and cookie dough bites on top of the cinnamon bun. I'm a peanut butter fanatic! Thus I loved the flavors of Peanut goodness wrapped around the cookie dough sweetness.  You can choose a frosting and then as many toppings as you want to include (you pay per topping). I loved my combination and would definitely try the coffee frosting next time. My friend liked her coffee frosting and pie crust toppings. Her roll was very full of cinnamon flavors, which was more like the traditional cinnamon roll idea. Good service, they let you taste the frostings to help decide on a flavor.  I liked the decaf coffee and would love to taste more frostings next trip!! If you have a sweet tooth & are hungry the whole roll is awesome. You could also split the roll with someone. Parking is in the lot nearby the Sun Valley movie theater.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

9tdywmv3chfyb_fjJApYGw.text: Tasty treat! Free WiFi to enjoy as well if you want to stick around and eat in and get a little work done

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Strawberry shortcake(crumbles,strawberries and cream cheese)

TdbP3zZSis-d94ElLmW_Uw.text: I convinced my family to come here for an after dinner treat.  Holy deliciousness aroma as you walk in, I mean MOUTH WATERING GOODNESS! I was excited to try this place as Ive heard about them on social media and thru my friends.    The location is cute and modern looking. Not very large of a space, about 6 tables.  We were the only customers there at 7 pm on a Saturday.   Cinnaholic Is neat concept where you can add different toppings but it does get pricy quick. They have about 12-15 different topics (for example: pretzels, fruits, nuts) that you can choose to add to your roll for an up charge. I ordered my cinnamon roll without icing but chose walnuts as my topping.  Cinnamon rolls are doughy and good but WAY TOOOOO sweet for my liking (and that was without any icing)!  They were out of brownies.  I also tried their chocolate chip cookie and it was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States
Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

Fk3WX8iYnoAzaZ9aId9P4w.text: Best cinnamon rolls for MILES around. Great atmosphere and friendly staff!! Super delicious rolls, don't skimp out on the toppings, the banana and caramel is the best combo

E8m-X2Klbr57E8B1FGAryg.text: After grabbing dinner at Trail House, our friend mentioned that he wanted to try this place - touting the Shark Tank backed themed Vegan cinnabon.  I ordered a bun with Hazelnut icing and walnuts, my wife got a cookie dough.  The buns were made fresh - so they were hot and when we opened the containers up I saw steam, a large bun - while not tall it covered a lot of area - and enough icing for a small wedding cake.  I dove in and took a bite.    First thing is first: Holy Type II diabetes Batman!  Talk about too sweet.  Second - trying just the bun - I liked that it was hot, but while it looked moist, it had a gritty and tasted dry on my pallet.  Not nearly as good as the rave - I have had local bakery, cinnabon, and the standard Pillsbury Dough Boy canned buns that tasted better and didn't cost $6+.    The cookie dough was boring - it tasted like artificially flavored cookie dough, had that same gritty after taste on the pallet, and was just not satisfying.  We through away 80% of what we bought - which hurt since it was a $13 trip when we would have been a lot happier with even a McDonald's ice cream cone.    Maybe it's that they don't use butter, eggs, milk, but whatever it is, Cinnaholic didn't do anything to help me want to eat vegan.  Shark Tank or not - wasting $13 at Cinnaholic gave me nothing but buyers remorse.  So many better choices out there for desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cinnaholic - Indian Trail, NC, United States

musU2k-Sn4f65FhUk5p5lQ.text: I am not much of a vegan, and truth be told, I am really not much of a fan of cinnamon rolls, but on a whim we stopped in Cinnaholic and decided to give them a whirl.  As with many "build your own" places, you are assaulted by way too many choices - but luckily they have some rather simple options, and that's where I went. As it turns out, it was pretty darn good.  The only real complaint that I had is that it was rather heavy on the icing. Cut that in half (at least) and I'd probably be a huge fan. Perhaps not enough to drive this far to get another, but if I were in the area again, I'd definitely give it a go (and incidentally, I think you can order it light on the icing).

ZAugP1WFVrjnAb-EBGIh4g.text: Okay, so I loveeeee cinnamon rolls!  I decided to try this place out since it was so close to where I live.  I went into the location and it is set up like regular coffee shop minus the hipster decor.  The wait time was around maybe 10-15 mins because this place is still pretty new.  The staff was really nice, I ordered a classic old skool cinnamon roll, no brownies, fruit special type of frosting, just regular scmegular roll.  I have to say that it was pretty good.  Nothing super special about it, just a roll with vanilla frosting.  I would give it 5 stars, but its not the best roll i've had.  I think it is a good place to get a sweet snack if you are in the area.  I wouldn't drive an 1 hour like some reviews, but definitely if you are in the area stop by and get you a roll.

Menh3lWpPgMacQ1f9zFMIg.text: These are hands down the best cinnamon rolls I've ever had! Highly recommend! Great food and service.

pPHRmDe-SBNdnmcdA5ePlg.text: Cinnamon rolls were too sweet and overpriced. The service was mediocre. I expected a lot more for my first visit, but it was disappointing.

U636McjOH7tgkw0PKwc73A.text: If I could give more than five stars I would. My boyfriend and I literally drove 30 minutes in the rain just to try these and they were well worth it. We got the original, cookie monster and blueberry pie (name could be wrong) flavors and they were insane. Hard to believe these are vegan and less than half the calories of normal cinnamon rolls. Staff was super friendly and helpful and we can't wait to go back!

_Z4L0glWivyZQ4LGpxAZbA.text: The almond frosting cinnamon roll with bananas on top was to die for!! Sooo good! The lady helping my friend and I out was very friendly and let us try many frosting flavors before choosing one. The rolls are very sweet though, not something you can eat every day, but if you're looking for a sweet treat this is the place to go!

vIxVYvbNN1nMbgHXoRsp0w.text: What can I say about this place!!! Literally the best place I have been to in a long time! Alfredo "Pasta" and his coworker are so friendly! They truly outdid themselves with their service and even the presentation of the food! They remembered my friend and I when we came back in too! Wish more places treated customers as this dynamic duo does!

M0GAiY6X7NpiIN7Swlmxrw.text: Delicious!! I would recommend trying the icing first before ordering  (The staff was more than accommodating considering I tried Cream cheese, hazelnut, lemon, Raspberry and Cake batter icing before ordering). I didn't end up liking any of the icings. They were all very sweet and had a weird flavor to them. That being said I got a small amount of Vanilla with Cookie dough and Strawberries on top. The roll was fantastic. Although I really could just come back for the cookie dough by itself.the staff was awesome and the roll was delicious. Will be back!

0Aa8E8q26J0KVCEZ0L2Ahw.text: The original with almonds and walnuts was AMAZING!!! Price is pretty good too! I think they start at $4.99 and each topping is like $0.50. Perfect place to treat yourself if you have a sweet tooth! I'll definitely be back!

QkZUAbrQWl_rzy0h8PzVag.text: The best cinnamon rolls ever!  And vegan to top it off !   Alfredo was so helpful and an a delight.  Worth the drive from Charlotte!

xAuV_DaClvNGd_PKLIyshw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The cinnamon rolls are absolutely amazing. I have just had the regular cinnamon roll, but kick your momma sideways, it's amazing. It was very clean and warm in the store. The employees were very nice. The best part was our rolls came right out of the oven when we ordered!

JvrRaStO_cd4WMmzdnYavw.text: Best Cinnamon rolls and brownies iv ever had. Even better that it's vegan! Friendly staff and fair prices. Will definitely go back for special occasions!

jjsyfyr56X86L0sxeBciYw.text: I wondered what a vegan cinnamon roll would taste like so I thought I'd give it a try. I'm not at all impressed. I got the classic, I think they call it "old skool," and the frosting is disgustingly sweet. I enjoy sweets but this is way too sweet. The dough is odd. I can't quite put my finger on it other than it has an odd flavor and a very doughy texture, almost as if it wasn't thoroughly cooked. The cinnamon roll left a film in my mouth after eating it and has made my stomach hurt. I'm   If you're aiming to have a healthy eating lifestyle, this is NOT the way to go - even if it is vegan. I understand splurging once in a while but with 730 calories, 600mg of sodium and 59g of sugar, I suggest splurging another way that tastes better. UPDATE: After the very passive aggressive reply by the manager of Cinnaholic, I definitely do NOT recommend this place. I refuse to give my business or a positive review to a place that employees such passive aggressive people. I have every right to post my thoughts and experiences about an establishment, after all that is what Yelp is all about. If Terri C. can't handle an honest review that doesn't support her establishment, then maybe it's best for her to get out of the food industry.

yxzAvLgEQxZn3FwpLyiARw.text: Really cool place. I'm sure their business will be successful. There were a few things though that made me consider not going back again. I got a cinnamon roll with raspberry icing. The actual cinnamon roll was very good in my opinion. Not a huge fan of that particular icing though. The whole cinnamon roll was too overpowering and sugary. Definitely check it out but get the basic cinnamon roll or basic cookie dough. The added toppings overall just makes it not great.

pDn4Oe0l0pATnAyFY3sVlg.text: Amazing! We've been twice and can't wait to go back! The people who run the shop are wonderful and so great to work with especially when you need to call ahead for a big order. Alfredo is the best! They put out a quality product that is always warm, gooey and delicious! Love this place!

dSkMBQdVHJkPuah9lCW2AA.text: Overpriced and my cinnamon bun wasn't even warm and it was hard not soft. Don't recommend this for any type of dessert craving.. not worth the money.

P-jfykw20baCJeUAziQwWw.text: This place is TERRIFIC! Most delicious cinnamon roll I have ever had, and the presentation and costumer service was incredible!
